place_of_publication.publication_title: J. Phys. Chim. Hist. Nat. Arts

treatment.description: Bract blades green, variously mottled in darker green or bronze, except not mottled in T. petiolatum. Flower sessile. Petals ± erect, except spreading in T. stamineum, mostly dark purple, maroon, yellow, green, or white, sometimes bicolored (dark basally).

references.reference: Freeman, J. D. 1975. Revision of Trillium subgenus Phyllantherum (Liliaceae). Brittonia 27: 1–62.
